I am requesting assistance for receiving my refund.  I have purchased a ticket for myself through KLM directly from the website www.klm.com 8/17/2015 totaling $895.45.  After two days, on 8/19/2015 I have decided that I will take my 2 year old daughter with me for the trip. I tried purchasing the ticket online again, but the system would not allow me to purchase separately for a child. I then tried to contact KLM airlines at 1 (866) 434-0320 and reached a representative who advised me that he can process the transaction over the phone and that he can connect both tickets as if I had bought them together so won’t have any problems when travelling with child. I then purchased an additional ticket for my daughter as over the phone for $1217.40 on my credit card. Later on the same day I have discovered that my daughter won’t be able to travel due to visa cancellation. I have called 1 (866) 434-0320 and was advised to call different number 1 (800) 618-0104 for cancellations. I called and explained to representative about my daughter’s visa denial. She told me that due to the fact that tickets were connected together in the system I have to request refund for both tickets online. As per policy she told me she won’t be able to do it over the phone. I was also told that due to visa situation I would also receive full refund for both tickets, as in reiteration was purchased as one ticket entry.  I informed the KLM representative that I still needed to travel but was told that I must purchase a new ticket for myself and the other two tickets ($895.45 and $1217.40) will be refunded as soon as I process the request online explaining what we spoke about.  After the conversation I went to the KLM online system refund form submission and I was only able to submit ticket for $895.95 only and I have a confirmation copy of it. I tried to submit a request for refund for my daughter’s ticket too, yet KLM’s website system was not able to locate the ticket. After several attempts I called 1-800-618-0104 again and was told that my daughter’s part of the ticket for some reason was processed through DELTA (because Delta and KLM in some are partners at times) system. I went to Delta to file a refund.   After locating Delta’s refund request form and locating my daughter’s ticket I submitted refund request online.  As soon as both requests were submitted I went ahead and purchased another separate ticket with KLM airlines. Later I have discovered on my credit card statement that I have received a full refund for daughter’s ticket for $1217.40 but only $80.95 for mine instead of $895.45. I was told by the KLM representative I would receive a full refund due to facts and their policy and having to purchase a new ticket for myself as the new one and ticket for myself and my daughter was considered as one ticket.   On 9/2/2015 I have submitted the claim online via my credit card provider to dispute the charge.  On 09/06/2015 I have received disputed amount of $814.50. But on 10/06/2015 I was re billed the charge again. I should not be charged $814.50 per KLM representative; this is unfair treatment and went against their rules.   As a result I am continuing with my dispute. I can attach all supportive documents for better assistance.  Please assist.

Beste medewerker,   Komende december vliegen wij voor het eerst met onze baby. De tickets zijn geboekt en wieg is gereserveerd. Nu is mij iets onduidelijk over het meenemen van de kinderwagen. Aan de telefoon kreeg ik te horen dat de kinderwagen mee mag tot aan de gate. Onze kleine is dan pas 3 maanden oud en kan alleen liggen. Wij gebruiken dan ook een kinderwagen met reiswieg. Dat is volgens mij niet het zogenaamde paraplumodel waar op de website over gesproken wordt. Ook begreep ik dat een maxi cosi mee mag. Kunt u hier meer duidelijkheid over geven? Het onderstel van de kinderwagen is inklapbaar. Voor de duidelijkheid nog even mijn vragen: - Mag de volledige kinderwagen inclusief reiswieg mee?  - Mag de maxi cosi mee?  - Wat mag mee tot aan de gate?  - Krijgen we de wagen dan ook meteen bij het uitstappen terug?   Dank en hartelijke groet, Priscilla Talle

Please if you received EUR from me, please remit the same amount in EUR to me.  Don't cheat!!!  Your service is really disgusting!! Hypothetical situation: You arrive in Dubai from Kabul, Afghanistan at 11:45, and proceed to Terminal 1 to check in to your KLM flight that departs at 00:50, approximately 12 hours from now. You have been trying to check in online, but for the past 12 hours, the website says there is an issue with your personal information, and cannot check you in. The office at DXB does not open until 21:50, 3 hours prior to your departure. So, what to do? Contact the Customer Service number! Did that. Apparently, wesimply cannot pull off such a complex task of checking in with the technolog, equipment, and personnel we have at this time. And the black iron of the whole situation: I PAID for this treatment! I judge the management ofhe airline posseses not the perspective for evaluation on thishubject; none of them would ever be subjected to this type of treatment. Enjoy the money I paid you; I will swim to the US before I enter into another transaction with your business. If my plane goes down tonight, THAT would be such a sweet slice of retribution, both TO me and FROM me.

Hello, I always try to change meal from the Standard one to something different on flights to Asia. E.g. spend more money, which should be good for KLM, right? However, during last 10+ flights within last two years or so, I only succeeded once. In all other cases, the booking process gets stalled, without any explanation. This is VERY user unfriendly. I can understand that the advertised special meals may only be available at some selected lucky flights. Should this be case, then you might consider upgrading your reservation system so it does not offer the these meals on flight where they are not available. Or specify clearly, under which circumstances they ARE available ("you must order it six weeks ahead and now it is too late." or something like that.) Then I do not need to waste my time trying to order something what I can not get anyway. Hope you will find this feedback how the advertised options (dont) work in real as useful. Have a great day! L.

I would advise everybody thinking more than once about it when considering flying with KLM. When you file a complaint, they try to soothe you that it will take long (my flight dates from beginning of August), probably hoping that you will get tired of it. The way they do it, I am sure it works with many people (who of course might privately decide not to take KLM again). They even wrote in their correspondence to me “and I am sorry to hear that your travel experience continues to be of deep concern to you “ as if they indeed presume the dissatisfaction will fade. Ours was too serious to let it rest. After a lot of time and nerve investment (file not found after a month, new file, etc), I got a mysterious phone call last week asking me whether I had a European or an African account for the compensation. Ironically, I knew nothing about a compensation. However, it seemed that that was not the responsibility of the person who called, she only had to ask that one question. I answered, European then, and asked to please mail me for further contact. A week later I got a mail, in which they more or less deny all responsibility. They refer me to Kenyan Airways but I flew on that route because KLM handled it and I thought they were reliable, but the very least ‘Customer Care’ could have done is say that they will pass on the complaint to Kenyan Airways, not letting me do everything all over again). They happily announce to me : “since we do not wish for this to be a lasting impression about our airline, we would be pleased to offer you a gift travel voucher, as a goodwill gesture “ (a bit more than a 100 euro, a pitiful amount for they very serious complaint(s) we had). And that should prove that they take their customers seriously? The term ‘customer concern’ when applied to KLM is a contradictio in terminis as they have no real concern for a customer, all they do is try to lull you asleep with some nice words but nothing really important to you. A voucher, by god, when you have said you have no intention to fly with them after what happened. Is that how they restore customers’ confidence? As the days-weeks-months pass, they make matters worse and worse because I did not write happily back as they seemed tohave presumed, but told them my opinion with the result that I again get the standard answer that it might take some time.  Grr. A friend of mine flies very regularly with KLM. Complained for the first time in his life two months ago, got a soothing answer back, stating that they hope that they would soon see him again. When checking in for his next flight a few weeks later, a purser comes to speak with him for about half an hour (so, they do not ‘lose’ files), writing down his comments, feeling very sorry, very empathic, etc... The friend thought, at least there will be a compensation or an upgrade to show they understand, they take responsibility for what happened to me. However, nothing happened. So, instead of doing something about the dissatisfaction of a loyal customer, they took half an hour more of his time just like they have taken many hours of our time as well (and still more as I will not let this rest).

Hello, You may recall I contacted you re a potential luggage problem on my flight from Manchester to Amsterdam 12/10 returning 18/10 and I was sceptical that everything was in order with my booking. Going out was ok but coming back my fears were not unfounded. The EMD I was sent were not accepted. The luggage check in lady had to phone someone who was adamant I hadn't paid. Fortunately I took it upon myself to print out all the Facebook posts, private messages, E/mails, booking forms also. After a while the lady on the desk decided to go ahead on her own and check the bags in, finally believing we had paid. However, this then lead to a mad rush to get to the gate and we were last to board without eating, drinking or visiting the shops. This made for an unpleasant experience, something I have tried putting right since July via telephone, e/mail and social media. Perhaps you are able to gauge my unhappiness with the whole process.

Omdat ik op zo'n korte termijn niemand meer kan vinden die met me mee wil/kan en ik geen zin heb om 3 dagen lang in mijn eentje Sacher Torte en schnitzels zo groot als deurmatten te eten, hebben we besloten het hele weekend te cancelen. Ik heb het hotel verteld dat er iemand anders in ons bedje mag gaan liggen ronken; de opera geïnstrueerd een paar feestnummers te zoeken om onze balkonplekken bij de opera Carmen op te vullen etc etc. Bij dezen wil ik ook jullie laten weten dat een andere reislustige KLM-fan mijn stoel kan krijgen. Ik weet dat KLM voor deze vlucht geen restitutie geeft maar misschien kunnen jullie de volgende keer als ik alsnog met zo'n blauw witte rakker naar Wenen ga, er voor zorgen dat er in ieder geval een stukje Sacher Torte voor mij klaarstaat om vast in de stemming te komen... dan ben ik als een kind zo blij en blijft KLM voor altijd mijn best friend :-)

Thank you KLM for rebooking 2 unaccompanied minors and taking them on a trip they will never forget. Yesterday my 15 year old daughter and her friend where scheduled to fly from AMS to San Diego trough LAX the moment they wanted to board the plane they where rebooked trough JFK. After a another delay they arrived in JFK with a 65 minute window to go trough customs get there luggage and check in again. You can imagine that this did not work out. Around 6pm Delta just told them that they had to stay the night in New York and that they would send two minors with a taxi to the Radisson and they could take the shuttle back the next morning and fly at 8.30 am. After me protesting to this situation the Delta staff had a bright moment and told the girls that they where not allowed to leave the airport and they would bring them to a place where they where supervised. This place was a small office no bed etc where they should stay the next 14 hours. After 2 hours on the phone with Delta and KLM staff they where rebooked to LAX where they landed after a trip of 24 hours and 11 hours later than planned having seen more from the US than necessary and being treated in a very bad way without there luggage. I must say smart thinking from KLM to rebook the girls because they might miss there connection in LAX next flight to San Diego would have bin two hours later  from LAX .Now they are in a car on there way to San Diego arriving there 16 hours later than scheduled nice work KLM . I am very curious how there flight back is going to be and when they will get there luggage. You can imagine that we are not a fan of KLM at this moment.

I flew with KLM business class on BKK to AMS flight# 876 on 22 July 2015 and was happy with the flight. Even though it was the day flight that departed BKK at noon, the cabin light was turned down after the meal for passengers to rest and sleep if required.  I then flew business class on KLM flight #876 from BKK to AMS again on 7 Sept 2015. But on this flight, the cabin light was kept on all the time throughout the flight. I asked a cabin crew why the light was not turned down after the meal. She did not know the answer but went to ask her supervisor who then came to explain to me that the day flight like this always had the light on. She said it was KLM's rule to keep the light on, and not normally ask passengers to close the windows either. She suggested I used an eye pad if I wanted to sleep. I politely disagreed with her and told her that I have flown with KLM at least 5 times a year for 10 years and the cabin light on all long haul flights were always turned down after the meal regardless of day or night flight. She refused to turn down the light.  Yesterday (18/10/2015), I flew this very same flight again and found the light was turned down after the meal was served.  It seemed that the inflight manager on KLM# 876 on 7 Spet 2015 made up her own rule to turn down or not to turn down the light. Or perhaps, it is KLM policy to change rules on daily basis - it is a ridiculous policy if it is true.

Dear KLM! On the 15th-16th of October I was flying from San Francisco to Los Angeles (KL 7899) than to Amsterdam (KL 604) than to Kiev (KL3096). On arrival to Kiev my baggage was lost. On 16th of October I wrote an application at Lost and Found in Kiev (Boryspil) asking to find my baggage. They promised to find it and send it to me in two days. In two days they told me that they found my baggage in Los Angeles, and it would be send to Kiev on the 18th of October. Up to now I am still waiting for my baggage and nobody at Kiev's airport is sure where it is. They say they are waiting for your information. I ask you to help me to find my baggage.  With respect, Iuliia Sikorska

Beste mensen van KLM,  daar ben ik weer. Kunnen jullie je nog m’n bericht van 27 september herinneren? Ik kan jullie feliciteren want het is gelukt. Vandaag heeft KLM zich wederom van haar slechtste kant laten zien en heb ik besloten om nooit meer een ticket voor een KLM/Delta/Air France vlucht te boeken. We hebben de afgelopen dagen meermalen contact gehad via Twitter maar ik zal de andere lezers van dit bericht ook even bijpraten. Op 28 februari 2015 heb ik 2 tickets van Amsterdam naar Londen Heathrow geboekt, inclusief de reservering en betaling van 2 Economy Comfort stoelen voor de heen- en terugvlucht. Deze stoelen zijn zowel voor de heen- als de terugvlucht bevestigd. Gisteren zag ik per ongeluk dat ik op de heenreis geen Economy Comfort stoelen meer heb maar Economy stoelen. Navraag leerde dat er een ander toestel wordt ingezet en niet alle Economy Comfort passagiers een stoel in Economy Comfort konden krijgen. Blijkbaar sta je als Flying Blue Silver members bij die herverdeling achteraan. In het toestel zijn nog wel stoelen bij de nooduitgang met extra beenruimte beschikbaar maar die zijn duurder dan de Economy Comfort stoelen. Ik zie niet in waarom ik nog een extra bedrag aan KLM moet besteden voor  stoelen bij de nooduitgang. Er werd mij keurig een link doorgestuurd naar een webpagina waar ik de toeslag voor de Economy Comfort stoelen kon terugvragen. Maar ik wil geen Economy vliegen, waarom zou ik anders stoelen in de Economy Comfort geboekt hebben? Ik heb aangegeven dat het KLM zou sieren als KLM ons stoelen bij de nooduitgang zou toewijzen, met gesloten beurzen. Jullie laatste reactie was dat dat niet kon omdat er geen uitzondering kon worden gemaakt?!. Uitzondering? Jullie wijzigen zonder enige melding mijn boeking, laten duidelijk blijken dat loyaliteit niets voor jullie betekent, durven mij nog extra geld te vragen voor een gelijkwaardig alternatief en laten als klap op de vuurpijl weten dat een uitzondering niet mogelijk is.  KLM heeft de laatste tijd last van dezelfde arrogantie als haar partners Air France en Delta en combineert dat met een totaal gebrek aan klantfocus en servicegerichtheid. En aan de andere kant maar klagen dat KLM het zo moeilijk heeft. Jullie verdienen geen passagiers! Maar jullie zijn nog niet van me af, reken daar maar vast op!

Beste KLM, voor de derde keer neem ik nu via Facebook contact met jullie op. En ik hoop nu eens wat terug te horen! Ik had voor 17 okt terugvlucht van uit Madrid. Maar door omstandigheden moest ik een weekje eerder terug. Ik kon de vlucht van 17 okt niet omboeken! Op 10 okt vloog ik terug met KL1706. Jullie hebben voor de vlucht van 10 okt al veel geld gekregen, maar ook voor een terugvlucht die jullie twee keer betaald hebben gekregen. usually I like travelling by KLM and its hospitality  but had not so good experience recently on KLM flight KL1118 and KL1107.  In KL1107 flight was freezing cold when passengers entered the flight. This should not be the case. flight should be at the normal temperature before boarding passenger into the flight. This created lot of trouble for the passengers and not smooth boarding experience. While coming back on KL1118 the flight was suffocating and air was not fresh in the cabin. Earlier I thought I am the only one facing this issue but  many people had the similar experience when we came out of flight and had a talk. KLM need to improve the user experience on the EU routes. May be this was the exceptional case but worth mentioning here.

Time with impulses, you ask via your SuperPrice campaign ? I live in Trondheim and my Dutch girlfriend  live in Amsterdam. KLM and FaceTime has been our good partners through many years, and we are so happy for the opportunity the KLM routes gives, both in the EU and to the world otherwise. (KLM also brought us to India in 2009, where we also met)    But no space for impulsivity! To keep costs low I must book ticket 1-2 months in advance. If I practice my impulsivity feeling in traveling to my love, I become quickly broke. The current ticket policy makes price 2-3x the closer the departure it comes.   I wonder why when I travel with KLM, that there are several  vacant seats. .. Why not let me (and other impulsive persons) have this opportunity, with eg. get a notification that there is a "LastMinuteTicket" for a nice price, even on the day of departure. Often I see KLM planes leaving and I would like use my chance to be more impulsive by surprising my dear, ask her out for a movie or something other nice, like others who have a partner in the "neighborhood"/living together. But such is unfortunately only a empty phrase in KLMs SuperOffer!  I wish KLM could be able to see this important human detail(love and impulsivity) and show the way in true impulsivity among peoples everyday life! 😘🙏🏻 (I am impulsive and ready, are you KLM?)

Hi KLM, een vriendinnetje van me en ikzelf hebben een bloedhekeltje aan de Nederlandse winter (lees: kou, regen, wind, sneeuw, hagel, hou op met me) en gaan daarom voor langere tijd overwinteren in het altijd mooie en warme Curacao. Wij willen eind november (28 of 29 november) vertrekken naar dit paradijs maar weten nog niet helemaal zeker wanneer (en of (sorry mam) we wel terug willen komen. Onze vraag is daarom: is het nog steeds mogelijk om een open ticket te boeken bij KLM? En zo ja, hoe kunnen wij dit het beste doen? En natuurlijk moeten twee meiden vééél meer bagage meenemen dan noodzakelijk (maar ja hallo, minimaal vijf maanden is niet niks zeg en ja die stijltang is zeker nodig). Hoeveel kg mogen wij nu precies meenemen? Mijn vriendin zegt 25kg, maar ik (eigenwijs als ik ben) dacht toch echt aan 35kg. Wie wint deze battle?  We horen het echt onwijs mega graag, want dat ticket willen we zo snel mogelijk boeken!!! Zonnige groet van ons!

Ik wilde de KLM van mijn teleurstelling laten weten. Om een betere prijs te krijgen, heb ik reeds begin Maart 2015, een vlucht Milaan - Amsterdam geboekt voor twee personen voor 9 Januari 2016 dus bijna een jaar van te voren. In Augustus 2015 heb ik door omstandigheden  onze vlucht 1 dag moeten vervroegen dus naar 8 Januari 2016.  Ik heb €70 per persoon moeten bijbetalen. In dezelfde periode begreep ik uit jullie newsletter dat er aanbiedingen waren die nog onder mijn eerste aankoopprijs lagen. En hier dus, ben ik enorm teleurgesteld in KLM. Geen enkele tegemoetkoming van jullie kant ook al zijn de boekingen ruim van te voren gedaan, heb ik evengoed een penalty moeten betalen! Ik vind dit geen pluspunt voor de KLM, een luchtvaart maatschappij die ik een van de beste vind!

SENIORS BEWARE OF USING KLM WEB SITE. We have been trying to get a refund on a luggage charge since Sept.18/15 we sent them the information they requested on Oct. 9/15 they said they would forward it to the right dept. but still no update. they have responded to some inquiries saying they are looking into it please be patient(HOW PATIENT DO WE HAVE TO BE) we are looking into it ,and others they have ignored completely.No one has ever tried to contact us it seems to us just another cash grab on unsuspecting seniors see enclosed articles.  We got a e-mail from Air Alitalia customer service and called the 1-800 number they supplied we talked to a rep named ETI from albania after a 20 minute conversation about the problem after a long hold he said the problem was their airline have different carry on weights and their was only 8kilos and that is why our luggage was to heavy so that is why the charge of 70 euros applied.when we booked on the KLM web site it told me that the luggage weight was 23kilos checked in and 12 kilos carry on for all our flights.please try to get this rectified the rep indicated that klm would have to call them.waiting your reply                                                                                                                                                                                          We are seniors and this is the second time using KLM the first was booked through a travel agent to Europe with a cruise. This year using a stop at Paris then to Rome to connect with a cruise we did our own air on the KLM website. The flight from Toronto to Paris our luggage weight was ok on a Air France(SISTER AIRLINE) flight, also on our return two flights home Rome to Amsterdam and then to Toronto. When we checked in for our flight Paris to Rome it was on a Air France counter with a boarding pass from them we were told our flight was with Air Alitalia and to check in at their gate when at the gate they had a makeshift scale and weighed everything including my wife's purse and said I would have to check in my carryon as they said along with a small bag was overweight and pay 70 Euros($115 Canadian) OR THE LUGGAGE WOULD NOT BE LOADED ON THE PLANE we had no choice but to pay they said that they did not have the same rules as KLM which we were not told about. We called customer service to complain when we got home and they said they could not help even though we had booked on their site we would have to call Alitalia with a tel.# they supplied. when we called that # was told that we would have to e-mail them as they do not accept phone calls which we did also to KLM but have not had any replies. To us it seems like a money grab as seniors we don't need the stress BEWARE WHEN YOU USE KLM WEB SITE to book your flights????????? this is how KLM treats us seniors.

I had a non stop flight I was booked and checked in for on 10/17 from Amsterdam to San Francisco.  There were 3 of us traveling together. We sat at the gate waiting to board and finally asked the desk what was going on when we were informed that we had been bumped from our flight. There was no announcement regarding this change.  Instead we were rerouted through Minneapolis which included a layover of about 5 hours.  It delayed our arrival home by about 10 hours. This was a very disappointing ending to what was my dream vacation of a lifetime.  We were told we would be compensated for this major inconvenience and also for costs incurred. Please advise on how to get this compensation.  Thank you.

Hoi,  Ik heb met de familie een reis naar Oslo geboekt en naar ons weten ook betaald. Nu blijkt vreemd genoeg dat er iets is misgegaan. We hebben op 23 September een mail met de e-tickets en de betaalbevestiging ontvangen. En op 24 september is er wel een mail ontvangen waarbij gevraagd wordt om jullie te bellen maar door drukte is dit er niet van gekomen (er stond ook verder geen redden in behalve dat het om onze vlucht ging) en we hadden de bevestiging al ontvangen dus is dit ons verder ontgaan. 6 oktober hebben we nog een mail ontvangen waarin staat "Bereid uw reis voor naar Oslo" Terwijl deze blijkbaar al geannuleerd was. Ik had dus nergens het gevoel dat er iets mis was met de betaling. Het is dat we gisteren even belden voor een baggage vraag anders stonden we op het vliegveld met een erg onaangename verrassing.  Ik hoop echt dat jullie hier nog iets mee kunnen doen uit coulance (gezien de vage berichtgevingen in jullie mail. Een betalingsbevestiging kan wel gestuurd worden, maar als iets dreigt geannuleerd te worden valt dit onder "privacy"? Ik kan u vertellen dat ik dit laatste veel belangrijker vind). We gaan namelijk met een groep en nu vallen wij buiten de boot. het ergste is nog dat onze kinderen zich hier heel erg op hebben verheugd.  Er is nog telefonisch contact geweest maar jullie bleven je schuil houden achter de regels en konden me alleen tickets aanbieden die 3-4 keer zo duur waren. Dat kan ik helemaal niet betalen!!!

After over a week, I am finally well enough again to write this. On the first of October, my wife and I were booked on the 2 o'clock (ish) flight from Norwich, Norfolk to Berlin, via Schipol. My wife requires special assistance, which was forthcoming, to access her seat on board as well as off. The departure was slightly delayed but made good time. In Amsterdam, we were left on the plane for approximately 30 minutes, possibly longer, until - after a change of crew and the cleaners boarding to clean around us - we were finally offloaded, to be told that because of 'our' delay, we had missed our connection to Berlin. We were unable to catch a connection later on 1st October because they were full. The earliest was the following day at 12.30. KLM arranged for us to stay overnight, first at Hotel Valkyrie, until we discovered that WE would have had to pay for our transport there and back, although this delay was not our fault. (I can feel my blood pressure rising at the memory.) We protested and KLM changed it to the Sheraton which was five minutes walk, pushing the wheelchair with my wife. The Sheraton was fine, if you like things corporate, but they welcomed, housed and we were able to dine and breakfast using KLM vouchers. My son in Berlin, mercifully went to our booked hotel and told them we were delayed. They held our room, but we had to pay for the night to add to the severe disappointment of not being with our son, his partner and a dear childhood friend of my son's. The following day, in spite of being assured - indeed instructed - to wait at a specific place near the hotel reception at a specific time, which we obeyed with 20 minutes to spare, no assistance arrived. The hotel porter helped me get my wife to the airport, which was brilliant of him - but no thanks either to Schipol or KLM. In due course, assistance took us to the departure gate for Berlin. We waited until the flight was called, but no assistance arrived. I protested to a KLM attendant who helpfully took our boarding passes and put us by the gate out to the plane. But still nobody came. I finally called to a man with a clipboard in a neighbouring kiosk and demanded attention and help. I was very cross by this time. He was emollient and as helpful as he could be. Eventually assistance arrived and we were loaded last. We got on, but at the greatest inconvenience to everyone. People were very forbearing. Finally, we got to Berlin to discover that my wife's walking mobility aid was missing from our hold luggage. You could say this was the final straw - compounded when it finally caught us up a day later minus a bag that hangs from it to hold important things for my wife when required.  I was dreading the return journey such that the stress exacerbated my ME and, although the journey home was more or less uneventful, thank God, I have taken over a week to recover enough to write this.  We lost valuable time with our rarely seen son, a night's unnecessary hotel charge and a day's hire age of the motor scooter we had waiting from a hire company at the hotel, awaiting our arrival. Not to mention the unwanted stress and work entailed for me as principal carer for my wife. I am very, very unhappy with KLM's service, not least because our previous trip to Berlin saw similar examples of ineptitude, delay and luggage loss.  We will not be flying KLM on future trips to see our son. We might as well pay considerably less and get a direct flight with Ryan Air or German Wings from Stansted, with the extra hassle an hour and a half's driving entails compared with 10 minutes to NIA. I would not recommend KLM to anyone; in fact I would actively discourage friends from using it.

In de praktijk blijkt de kans op een lagere prijs dus groter wanneer je wacht met boeken. Goedemorgen KLM,  Binnenkort vliegen we naar New York. Via jullie handige app de vlucht in orde gemaakt en stoelen gereserveerd. Uiteraard naast elkaar, op rij 27, want dat is wel zo gezellig. 1 Stoel daarvan betrof een voorkeursstoel (gangpad), dus deze gekocht. De ander betrof de middelste stoel in een rij van 3 en dus geen voorkeursstoel. Deze gratis gereserveerd.  Nu kijk ik gisteravond heel toevallig even in de KLM-app en wat schetst mijn verbazing: De voorkeursstoel is verplaatst naar rij 25 en de ander stond nog steeds op rij 27. We zaten dus zonder enige mededeling niet meer naast elkaar. Het is dat ik toevallig even keek! Uiteraard heb ik er snel weer voor gezorgd dat we weer naast elkaar zouden zitten. Echter, wederom verbazing aan mijn kant. Op rij 27 was in zijn geheel geen voorkeursstoel meer te vinden (kennelijk toch geen populaire rij ;) ), dus dan de middelste stoel van de rij van 3 maar verplaatsen naar rij 25. En ja...alweer verbaasd, want opeens bleek deze stoel ook een voorkeursstoel. Deze ook maar gekocht... (later zelf nog beiden verplaatst naar rij 24)  Nu gaat het mij niet om die 30,- euro. Vliegen kost nu eenmaal geld en als je dat belachelijk vindt, dan kan je beter thuis blijven. Maar wat ik nu wel eens wil weten is waarvoor ik nu betaal. Hoe kunnen die voorkeursstoelen zo verschuiven. Het heeft niet met de configuratie te maken, want de middelste stoel van de rij van 3 heeft net zo veel beenruimte als aan het raam en gangpad en kan net zo ver naar achteren. Je zit alleen tussen 2 mensen in en dat zou kunnen verklaren dat dit geen voorkeursstoel was. Kennelijk is het nu opeens wel een voorkeur van velen om tussen 2 andere passagiers in te zitten? Ik snap het niet meer.  Uiteraard nog los van het feit dat het allemaal prachtig is om dit via de KLM-app makkelijk te kunnen regelen. Keurige koppeling met je Flying Blue, creditcard en e-mail. Top! Maar is het dan geen kleine moeite om even te laten weten via de e-mail dat 2 pax in 1 boeking uit elkaar gezet zijn? Dat zorgt ervoor dat mensen niet verrast worden als ze het niet op tijd opmerken.   Alvast bedankt voor jullie aandacht voor dit toch wel lange verhaal.   grt. Sven

Para todo pasajero que utiliza la aerolínea lo primero que debe de recibir es seguridad tanto al momento del vuelo como al momento de transportar el equipaje, con mucho desagrado y malestar debo informar que en el viaje de un familiar tanto de ida como de regreso le perdieron una de las maleta, de venida se la entregaron abierta e incompleta faltándole las cosas que traía para obsequiar a sus seres queridos y que con tanto amor y también sacrificio se logra obtener, no es posible que esto ocurra por segunda ocasión a su regreso y la respuesta que indiquen es que no saben donde está la maleta cuando es responsabilidad de la empresa responder por el equipaje. Me pregunto quién responde por las pérdidas ocasionadas? Este tipo de situaciones son las que dañan la imagen de una empresa ya que si estuviera próxima a viajar indiscutiblemente NO lo haría por KLM por temor a que pierdan mi equipaje. Señores a poner más cuidado a este tipo de situaciones que causan malestar al usuario. Ojalá le aparezca la maleta a mi familiar pero esta vez con sus cosas completas.

Beste KLM,  Vorige week reisden wij met jullie maatschappij KLM i.c.m. Delta Airlines van Amsterdam naar Los Angeles om daar de overstap te kunnen maken naar het geweldige San Francisco. Aangekomen bij onze overstap bij verliep het toch allemaal iets minder plezant dan verwacht. Ten eerste had onze vlucht al 50 minuten vertraging. Geen ramp, maar toch is dat niet zo leuk omdat we al een ruime 10 uur in het vliegtuig hadden gezeten. Nadat de 50 minuten waren verstreken, dachten we eindelijk te kunnen boarden bij de gate. De aardige jongeman bij de gate vertelde ons echter doodleuk dat de boardingpassen niet geldig waren en dat wij naar de KLM balie  moesten terug lopen helemaal in een andere hal waar wij eerder vandaan kwamen. Daar aangekomen bleek tot onze grote verbazing de balie gesloten te zijn, terwijl het 5 uur s'middags was. Volgens de vrouw bij de informatie balie moesten we maar bellen. Dat volgden wij maar netjes op. Niet te weten dat het telefoongesprek wel anderhalf uur duurden. Om 19 uur vertelde de vrouw aan de andere kant van de lijn dat zij onze vlucht had omgeboekt naar de vlucht van 20 uur in plaats van de oorspronkelijke 17.00 uur. Vervolgens moesten wij opnieuw inchecken en uiteindelijk konden wij na ruim 3 uur naar onze uiteindelijke vakantiebestemming; chagrijnig en moe dat we waren. Onze koffers bleken bij aankomst in de luchthaven met de eerste vlucht mee gegaan te zijn (die wel!). Direct in San Francisco hebben wij Delta al aangesproken, maar tot op heden geen reactie. Ik kijk uit naar de reactie van KLM hierop.   Met vriendelijke groet,   Arjan en Kaz

Dear KLM, I flew from Punta Cana to Charles de Gaulle yesterday (the 16th of Oct) on flight AF0969 and really wanted to upgrade to Economy Comfort. I read on the website that I could do so using points, but that this could only be done through the website more then 24 hours before the flight. As I was reading this a couple of hours before the flight this was not an option. The website stated that I could also do this at checkin or on the plane. At checkin I was first told that yes there were seats available but that I had to pay. I indicated that I would like to use my miles as payment. This was not possible. I quoted the website and the clerk contacted his supervisor. She came over and said that it wasn't possible as there were no seats available at all. As I know some people don't make their flights I again tried at the gate, but the lady said that the flight was completely full and she couldn't do it as it had to be done at checkin. When I entered the plane I asked one of the crew members if it would be possible to upgrade to economy comfort if any there was a seat available. It turns out that yes there were indeed seats available; great! But no, the lady at the gate was brought into the plane to tell me again that it isn't possible to do it there. She claimed that it was due to fact that she didn't have a terminal. So I had to stay in economy while my colleague (sitting in economy comfort) looked at 3 empty chairs. I wasn't asking for a free upgrade, but was willing to pay (preferably miles, but otherwise money). As this is a night flight I really wanted to get as much quality sleep as possible and I think KLM/AirFrance missed an opportunity to make money while also disappointing an otherwise loyal customer. Why wasn't this possible and why did multiple people gave the false impression that there were no seats available, when in fact there were free seats available?

Hello, I travelled from AMS to Denpasar on 14th October.  I am a Skymiles Platinum flyer and I am travelling with my wife.  I booked and paid for my wife's Economy Comfort seats on August 28th.  (I have confirmation in writing from KLM that 12F and 12G were booked for all journey to and from Denpasar).  I very specifically chose seats for both outward and return in row 11 or 12 sitting next to each other as these are the best rows for us.  On checking in on 14th October, I was appalled to find our seats had been randomly to 14C and 17B!!!  I spent 90 minutes in Schiphol trying to sort out this mess created for no good reason by KLM.  The ground crew and cabin crew tried their best to sort this out but we did not end up travelling together.  The cabin crew reported this to the Singapore ground crew on the stop and they checked the system for our return flights on the 19th October and AGAIN the same thing had happened.  I asked very clearly, and the ground crew in Singapore completely understood my reasoning that I wanted seats in row 11 or 12.  KLM seats on the 777 are narrow enough, most airlines have 9 across on the 777 (e.g. BA and Delta) and row 10 is too narrow for us.  Yet again KLM has let us down, and clearly it means nothing being an Elite status flyer,  I offered to pay towards upgrades to World Business but they could not do this on the way out, maybe this can be arranged on the way back (or even in the ethos of service to Elite Flyers you might even see your way to providing these to us for free for all the hassle this has caused.  At the very least I want my money back for the Economy Comfort seats I paid for, it is unacceptable for such seat changes to happen, when there has clearly not been a change of aircraft.  our names are RJC Liebert and J Liebert.  Thank you.

Re KLM0809 - AMS to Jakarta Oct 13th 2015 This trip was one of our regular trips to Europe to see our extended family. We have travelled on over a dozen airlines over time. Our experience with KLM was easily the worst! On this trip my wife and 3 children travelled on 3 airlines. Qantas, Garuda and KLM. Our total baggage never exceeded 80% of our total allowance as a family. We had 3 bags of approx 26Kg each for the whole family. With ALL other airlines we have EVER travelled this has not been a problem and even though at times the individual limit per passenger was less than our individual bag weight. We were always allowed to aggregate the family allowance and were NEVER charged excess baggage. But our first encounter with KLM check-in was a hooror story of non-functional check-in machines, either rude or plain uninterested staff and unnecessarily rigid rules not allowing aggregation of our family baggage allowances. We were faced with the choice of an embarrassing and ignominious repacking of our bags mid airport or a paying a ransom of EUR300 for less than 8Kg of "excess" baggage. We were totally disgusted with the "couldn't care less" attitude of the check-in staff who seemed more interested in their private conversation than in customer service. There was not even the tiniest bit of feigned empathy with  our predicament. On-board the flight the staff though friendly and approachable, were almost impossible to call to the seats. I waited over an hour for a staff member to attend to my call light to fix my frozen entertainment screen. Then one staff member listened to my request and failed to return at all. I had to almost physically block a staff member from passing our row to get them to take ownership. I was then castigated for not calling them earlier for a simple 5minute reset. The food was good and enjoyable but too small in serving size for adults and too large for children. Needless to say we won't be putting KLM on our preferred list of airlines for future trips.

Hallo,   Ik zit met een aantal vragen en ik hoop dat jullie mij hiermee verder kunnen helpen. Op dit moment verblijf ik samen met mijn ouders en mijn minderjarig dochtertje in Suriname. Op 31 oktober vliegen wij weer terug naar Nederland. Op Schiphol wou ik een toeristenkaart kopen voor mijn dochter en mij omdat we Suriname anders niet binnen kwamen. Op Schiphol kreeg ik deze toeristenkaarten niet omdat ik geen documenten bij me had dat ik kon aantonen dat ik moeder ben en dat ik ook de enige gezagshouder ben. Er werd mij vertelt dat ik bij aankomst in Suriname dan de toeristenkaart moet aanvragen en deze heb ik ook zonder enige problemen gekregen. Ook werden er mij geen vragen gesteld.    Nu is mijn vraag dus als ik eerder terug vlieg zijn er extra kosten aan verbonden?  En kan ik mijn dochter zonder enige problemen terug laten vliegen met mijn ouders?  Ze draagt de achternaam van mijn ex vriend wat ook op haar paspoort staat aangegeven en op de heenweg zat het gelukkig allemaal mee zonder enkele problemen.   Ik hoop dat jullie mij hiermee z.s.m. kunnen helpen.   Groetjes!

i know I'm late with my comment regarding our October 4th returning flight from Budapest to Los Angeles but both my husband and I got really sick (flu or cold with fever) after this stressful ordeal we went thru with KLM. Our trip was already stressful due to the fact that it was an emergency trip for my mother in laws funeral.  We went for only 5 days. So on the morning of Sunday October the 4th for our returned flight at 6 AM they announced that our flight is delayed due to weather condition (fog ) at the Amsterdam airport. We were not concerned at that point because if we can't go  our connecting flight will be delayed too right ?  Well it was not the case.  But just read on. So after an hour or so our plane got the ok to leave. We get above the Amsterdam airport and of course we cant land so we have to go to an other airport but the pilot announced that the company only let them pick up half an hour extra fuel at Budapest. Wow  great management decision.  So luckily a small non commercial airport 25 minutes from Amsterdam had fuel for us and let us land there. of course no border patrol so while fueling we had to stay on the plane. i did not like it I did not know it is legal but I guess sometimes its done. So after the fueling we were able to go back to the Amsterdam airport but what do you know our plane left with out us. We were still not that concerned because I thought they will automatically reschedule us to an other flight even if its not KLM. It was not so. They directed us to a station called Tansfer 4 (T4)  when we got there already at least  300-500  people were standing in line. This was around 11:30AM. So we're in line hours pass no announcement. People just standing not sitting !!! Around 4 5 pm they start to give out water  and some sandwiches cookies of course its not enough for everybody. Now my husband and I worry. Still no announcement. We were lucky we had money so we went to buy some coffee and croissant   I asked a young lady who was in KLM  uniform if we should leave and try to find a hotel since it does not look we will make it to the desk there to do a new schedule she said we will loose our place and be delayed even longer. So we were just  standing there  until 11:30 pm mind you the line was getting longer and longer now were talking at least a thousand  of people.  So  we were almost at the station with the agents when they announced that the regulation does not allow the agents to work longer so they are closing and come back in the morning!!! Oh also they cant help with getting a hotel because in Amsterdam hotels are limited but if we can find one they will reimburse us with a 150 euro. Well the closest was the Hilton for 400 euro. So we don't know Amsterdam at all we have about 4 hours anyway by the time we go out from the airport so we decided to stay right there. Oh after the announcement because we  were not happy they sent in border patrols  with guns that really helped with the morals. So aon and on tit went they sent us the next morning to see if we can make it stand by of course we did not. So around 2 PM on Monday they were nice enough to give us a voucher for a hotel because they were still unable tto find a flight that they could get us to Los Angeles. Now we were suppose to to be back on Sunday 11:30 Am so I could go to work. We had pet sitter for our pets We lost our wages or luckily we had Vacation days  left that we had to use so we around 1000 dollars extra with everything not to talk about the other sick days that I had to take and all the food and everything. I could just go on and on. They finally put us on a flight back to LA on Tuesday. I had to come in to work on Wednesday because of computer and accounting problems and got even more stressed and sick . And had to Take additional sick leave so more money loss!!! So to say the least I am very unhappy with KLM. I use to choose them over other airlines even if they were more expensive but that's not going to happen anymore.This was not a 3 days snow storm we talking about this was only a few hours delay how did it turn in to a 48 hours misery I would like to hear them explain it and  also the attitude how they handle when people breakdown from not sleeping for 30 hours and from not knowing what is happening?  They need to evaluate they damage control management and all management period.

KLM put my faith in your hands: trust you don't fly over dangerous terrain:  Het Europees Agentschap voor de veiligheid van de luchtvaart (EASA) waarschuwt luchtvaartmaatschappijen en luchtvaartautoriteiten voor Russische raketten boven de Kaspische Zee, Iran en Irak.   Deze kruisraketten worden sinds woensdag door Russische oorlogsschepen op de Kaspische Zee afgeschoten op doelen in Syrië. Op weg daarnaartoe komen ze door het luchtruim van Iran en Irak.  De vluchtroutes van de raketten liggen kilometers lager dan die van vliegtuigen uit de burgerluchtvaart. De raketten vormen normaal gesproken dan ook geen gevaar voor commerciële vluchten. De EASA geeft geen advies, alleen een waarschuwing voor een 'potentieel' gevaar.   De KLM vliegt niet boven Syrië of Irak, wel boven Iran. Omdat ook KLM-toestellen veel hoger vliegen dan de kruisraketten, ziet het bedrijf op dit moment geen aanleiding om de routes aan te passen. "Uiteraard houdt de KLM de situatie nauwlettend in de gaten", laat het bedrijf weten.

Beste KLM,  in mei dit jaar heb ik meerdere vluchten binnen de Verenigde Staten gemaakt.   De tickets heb ik telefonisch bij jullie geboekt aangezien ik altijd erg te spreken was over jullie service. Ik ben dan ook trouw Flying Blue Member bij jullie.   Tijdens het telefoongesprek werd mij gevraagd of ik bezwaar had dat een aantal vluchten door Delta verzorgd zouden worden. Geen probleem, niet wetende dat ALLE vluchten door Delta verzorgd zouden worden!   Mijn vlucht met Delta vanuit Las Vegas naar Charlotte, Douglas heeft 11 uur vertraging opgelopen en ik heb uiteindelijk met een andere vliegtuigmaatschappij gevlogen en dat ik hierdoor een Memorial Day barbecue gemist laat ik even ter zijde. Hier heb ik een aantal maanden geleden ook al contact over gehad met jullie klantenservice en wat er met het probleem word gedaan noem ik afschuiven. Jullie zeggen dat ik bij Delta moet zijn om hier een teruggave voor te verwachten. Delta zegt natuurlijk dat ik bij jullie moet zijn, aangezien de ticket via jullie geboekt is.   Het enige wat ik heb gekregen tijdens mijn verblijf op het vliegveld is 2 broodjes maar geen echte maaltijd. Deze heb ik zelf moeten kopen. Al met al vind ik de manier van zaken doen op zijn zachtst gezegd sneu en ik heb het gevoel dat mij onrecht is aangedaan. Door jullie. Dit is erg jammer, nogmaals, ik ben altijd tevreden geweest over jullie service. In deze stellen jullie mij erg teleur. Een uurtje of 2 vertraging is niet erg, maar 11 uur tussen de gok apparaten zitten is wat overdreven. Mij lijkt een vergoeding nog steeds op zijn plaats.  Overigens wil ik melden dat jullie partner Delta echt verschrikkelijk is. Tijdens één van de vluchten zat er op een gegeven moment een levende kakkerlak op mijn broek! Sowieso was het duidelijk dat de vliegtuigen tussen de vluchten door niet schoon werden gemaakt en dit kan mijn reispartner Kevin beamen.   Ik hoop dat jullie hier iets mee doen, in de zin van, het probleem oplossen. Mochten jullie aanvullende informatie willen, ben ik bereid die te geven, kan ook via email.  In afwachting van uw antwoord(en)

Lieve KLM,  Ik vlieg heel graag met jullie en wil dit ook graag blijven doen, maar tijdens het boekingsproces wat ik net ben doorgegaan begin ik toch mijn twijfels te krijgen.  Retour van Amsterdam - NY via de huidige kortingsdeals, 1 persoon kost €520, wil je voor 2 boeken is deze vlucht duurder en kom je via de normale prijzen uit op €1.080. Dat is natuurlijk al een raar iets dat je 2 tickets apart kunt boeken voor een kleiner prijsje dan in een keer 2 tickets boeken.  Vervolgens komen we bij het betaalscherm, en dan vertellen jullie me dat ik met een AirFrance / KLM FlyingBlue American Express kaart nog eens €30 moet betalen voor de verwerkingskosten? Jullie hebben de kaart zelf uitgegeven, neem aan dat je dan in gedachten neemt dat die weleens gebruikt kon worden om vliegtickets te boeken bij jullie...   Volgende keer zou ik graag met m'n FlyingBlue kaart afrekenen zonder rare fratsen dat ik daar €15 per ticket voor hoef te betalen.  Met vriendelijke groet,  Bob

MON MESSAGE AYANT ÉTÉ SUPPRIME SANS QUE L'ON NE ME REPONDE JE LE PUBLIE À NOUVEAU : Bonjour, Puisque le service client est incompétent je vais m'exprimer ici. J'ai récemment eu une très mauvaise expérience avec air France KLM, pour faire simple mon bagage à été perdu par  KLM, le personnel de bord était au courant et en riait à coeur joie pendant le vol, je n'étais pas au courant donc je n'ai pas réagi sur le coup, c'est en voyant mon nom circuler sur une vulgaire feuille de papier sur le tapis à bagage à Tokyo que j'ai compris que c'était de moi que l'on riait et qu'il y avait un problème avec mon bagage. Le personnel de bord, toujours aussi peu professionnel, m'a laissée me débrouiller seule à Tokyo et est tranquillement parti se reposer ! Mon bagage est arrivé 2j en retard, complètement détruit, encore une preuve du service pitoyable d'air France KLM ! Finalement air France me propose, après un mois de harcèlement, de me rembourser un tiers du montant frais engagés : pas de remboursement de mes frais téléphoniques conséquents dû à la perte de mon adresse à Tokyo par le personnel de l'aéroport (autant continuer dans la connerie), pas de remboursement de ma valise détruite, pas de dédommagement de mes 2 journées gâchées, bref, le montant de l'indemnité que l'on me propose ne couvre même pas la moitié des frais que j'ai dû engager à cause de l'incompétence d'air France. J'attends donc une réponse rapide et un dédommagement à la hauteur des préjudices encourus RAPIDEMENT.

Hallo,  Deze week wilde ik kosteloos Flying Blue punten overhevelen van mijn account naar die van mijn partner ivm het boeken van een reis. Om dit mogelijk te maken, moest mijn Flying Blue kaart gekoppeld worden aan mijn AMEX kaart. Helaas is Flying Blue niet in staat om deze koppeling te maken, dus werd ik verwezen naar AMEX. Nadat AMEX de actie heeft uitgevoerd, duurde dit 3 werkdagen alvorens dit zou zijn verwerkt. Na 3 werkdagen neem ik contact op met Flying Blue om de punten te overhevelen, maar tot mijn grote verbazing, kunnen zij de koppeling niet zien en daardoor dus ook geen punten overhevelen. Helaas kunnen zij weinig, dus word ik weer eens verwezen naar AMEX. En AMEX geeft aan dat de actie is uitgevoerd. WAT NU??? De partijen gaan contact met elkaar opnemen hierover, maar niemand kan aangeven hoe lang dit gaat duren... Als de ene een mail stuurt naar de ander, duurt het minimaal één werkdag voordat deze wordt ontvangen. Graag snel actie!

Lieve KLM. Ik vind het echt te gek dat ik steeds aanbiedingen krijg voor vluchten naar Bogota! Vandaag de derde in een paar maanden tijd.  Ik vind Bogota namelijk zo tof dat ik al heb geboekt. Voor een hogere prijs die (vermoedelijk) niet om te zetten is naar een nieuw ticket. Dus dan is het wel jammer om hetzelfde ticket steeds voor een paar honderd euro minder voorbij te zien komen.  Het zou briljant zijn als ik alsnog gebruik mag maken van de aanbieding, dus mijn andere ticket kan omzetten! En anders zou aanbevelen niet meer aanbiedingen te sturen op een reeds geboekte vlucht :-). Thanks!

On 24 August, I travelled with KLM from Amsterdam to Edinburgh but my suitcase did not arrive in Edinburgh. I reported the missing suitcase at Edinburgh Airport. This suitcase contained all my tropical clothing and personal effects that I had needed for a trip to Tanzania. When I had not received any information from KLM on 28 August, I completed a Baggage Inventory & Claim Form as I was due to travel to Tanzania again on 3 September. I spoke to someone at KLM Customer Care last week and was told that my claim "wouId be passed to my colleague who will deal with it". I heard nothing from KLM until this morning when I received an e-mail asking for an inventory of the items in the suitcase. This inventory was part of the Baggage Inventory & Claim Form. I again spoke to someone in KLM Customer Care and was again told that my claim "would be passed to my colleague who will deal with it". Is this the way that KLM treats all its passengers whose baggage has been lost? I find this to be completely unsatisfactory.

Der Logistikpartner Avia-Partner geht nicht ans Telefon und ruft auch nicht zurück seit 3 Tagen rufe ich da an !! Und die Social Media Abteilung von KLM hat nur eines im Sinn, ihr Image aufrechtzuerhalten den Kunden zu vertrösten und im 4 Stunden Takt sich zu wiederholen: "Entschuldige bitte die verspätete Antwort. Bitte gib uns etwas Zeit, wir melden uns bald bei dir zurück."  Also ich hoffe ihr verliert nie ein Gepäck bei dieser Airline, denn die  Dienstleister von KLM , die hier im Spiel sind glänzen durch ihr Unvermögen! Und wenn so was passiert dann benutzt diese Plattform um auch mal von der heilen Welt in die Servicewüste zu blicken und anderen Leuten klar zu machen wem sie ihr Gepäck anvertrauen!! Und ich bin nicht der einzige dem es mit KLM so geht !!!

I traveled with KLM from México to Madrid in august 14. My baggage was lost almost all my trip. I had my bag back with me in the airport of Madrid on my return to México, because KLM wasn't able to send it to the place where i was. So, i've never had my belongings with me. I spent my only 2 days free in Madrid looking for clothes and stuff. It was a very important trip to me, and it was a bad experience because i had to worry for stupid stuff like making calls to the airline, making calls to my insurance company, etc, among other things. I did not have signal in my phone, i was in a very limited place, with no wifi, no public telephones nearby and people from KLM asked me to fill some forms online for my lost baggage, forms that didn't work (even when i tried to fill them in many devices, i had to ask my sister to try it in México in her computer and she couldn't too!). The people from KLM couldn't help me when i had this problem, and they don't offer me any solution at all, in fact, they just gave me an Amsterdam number to try to locate my bag there, not before warning me they almost NEVER pick up the phone. Back in México, filling the claim in my computer was a pain in the ass too cause it didn't work either, i had to ask for help to the community manager of KLM Spain Facebook. This person (or persons) was/were the only people who make an effor to help me during this process. Now i know KLM asked for help to Delta. In september 24, a guy named Victor Velez called me to check the claim with me. He send me an email asking me for my full name, my account number and my RFC. I replied with this information inmediately. He also said in his email: "Se transfieren los pagos dentro de 10 días hábiles después de haber recibido la información bancaria (Payments are transferred within 10 business days after receiving bank information)". After the 10 business days, i began to worry because i didn't have my money back. I called to Delta, and yesterday they gave me a new claim number, i don't know why (it was 16465874 and now is 17459183) and then, today, the customer service told me i had to wait, maximum, 45 business days in the worst of the case. I need my money back after october 20, because i need to pay things in my credit card and i'm sure you or KLM are not going to pay the interests or the money i spent in long distance calls. Please, don't tell lies to your customers. If you say 10 business days, that's what has to be! I need my money NOW! How i regret doing this claim to you and not with my insurance company instead! KLM customer service is a nightmare!

When I flew to Portugal we couldn't receive our stroller and didn't have any message until one day before the day we left Portugal.   so we spent almost １week in Portugul without a stroller.  And since our flight was too early to pick up the stroller at Lisbon airport we claimed about it at Narita airport.  1 week later after coming back to Japan finally we got back our stroller  but one wheel was lost.  I called to the agency of KLM at Narita airport and talked with the staff of KLM agency of Narita airport they just said it is shipping company's responsibility so I should talk with the shipping company.  I didn't accept the offer and asked the KLM agency to decide which responsibility it is.  And they called me back and said the shipping company said a stroller's damage is not their responsibility and KLM also didn't take any responsibility because I claimed the damage after 1 week later.  I also talked with the chief manager Mr Miyazaki they just said their responsibility is within 1 week.  I can understand the rule in a normal case.  but in our case we got so much damage that we didn't get back our stroller during the trip and also 1 week after coming back to Japan.  and no staff apologize for it just sent back the useless stroller since it lost one wheel.  if  you say you are not responsibility for it I can't accept your attitude to ignore this trouble and damage. And Mr Miyazaki said he didn't talk with KLM because he knew KLM didn't do anything for this kind of trouble and damage.  he didn't even talk with KLM and tried to settle up this matter with us.  so I asked him to let me know KLM contact No.  but he didn't send me any massage.  so I wrote down about this matter on your facebook to let you know this terrible story.  I am very afraid to leave our important staff with you since the attitude of staff related with this matter were all terrible. I expect the sincere reaction about this.

we received refund vouchers recently, when flying your airline, due to being delayed in travel. At the first airport we were told to go to the KLM in Paris to cash in our refund voucher, which was our next stop on our way home. In Paris we were told we had to go to the KLM/Air France counter in Toronto. In Toronto, we were advised that we had to do it online. On line I found out we needed to have online banking, so KLM could directly deposit our refund into my account. So I set up to have my bank account online. After filling out the information online we immediately received confirmation that our file was being processed. A few days later I received an e-mail that the "swift code" and "bank code" were incorrect on the refund form, and, I needed to "adjust refund form". When I click on the "adjust refund form", I get a message that our file is being processed. So I filled out the refund form on your website, a second time. Then I get an e-mail that reads as follows: "Please be informed that we rejected this request as the refund of the document submitted is already being handled via another request that you submitted earlier. We hereby assure you that your refund is in progress, and we kindly ask for your patience until the refundable amount is transferred back to your credit card / bank account." How do I contact KLM and provide you with the correct Swift Code and Bank Code when I can't get through on the "adjust refund form" nor online?

Dear KlM✈️  We had a terrible terrible experience with KLM on Oct 4. We were trying to fly to SF from Amsterdam but could not because of Fog delays. I understand that there will be delays because of weather but the way KLM handled the situation was in humane! We were told to go to transfer line. We waited and waited and waited for hours. We kept asking KLM assistants and they kept telling us to wait so we stood in line for 12 hours. At about 11:15, they made an announcement that they need to close and we all need to leave. We were all shocked,upset,hungry,tired and humiliated. How can KLM mislead so many people? How come no announcements the whole time we stood in line? We were told to keep standing in line, we will stay open,cots will be provided! Terrible terrible experience. Elderly people in line, people from China cutting. It was bad! Real bad. I would fire the manager in charge that night. This would never happen in America! So disappointed with the way KLM handled this! We had no luggage, no hotel voucher, nothing.  We were roaming Amsterdam in the middle of the night not sure where and what to do! We ended up in a pot infested dump of a hotel! KLM u owe us and everyone else that had to go thru this pure evil hell day on October 4th. Because of your bad communication u caused all of us so much grief. This all could have been avoided if someone got on the loud speaker early on and told us to all go and please don't wait in line! Shame on you! Seriously felt like we were at a concentration camp. Never ever again will we fly KLM!

I submitted the above letter to the customers service on September 28. It concerns the damages caused by professional negligence of KLM/Air France.  I didn't hear anything from your company since then.  Shall we meet in the Court? Cordially, Dr. David Gurevich  CC: KLM Israel, KLM USA, Air France ------ I purchased a flight which departs 24/9/2015 from Boston to Tel- Aviv with a connection in Paris (CDG). The ticket was purchased from KLM. The flight was operated by Air France.   My flight from Boston was delayed by 2 hours: AF0333 on September 24, 2015 departed in 23:45 (instead of the original time 20:45). No explanation was provided for the delay. Due to the delay, I missed my connection in CDG to TLV.   Due to the above mentioned failure, I was put on a different flight to TLV from CDG on September 25, 2014: AF1120 with a departure from CDG in 17:35 (instead of 10:50 am). I arrived to TLV on 23:00 (instead of original arrival time of 16:20). The delay is over six and half hours. The following damages, inter alia, were caused to me by this above failure of the flight company:  1. I missed my scheduled appointment in Tel-Aviv.  2. I arrived in Tel-Aviv after the Shabbat starts. During the Shabbat, Jews avoid travelling.  3. There is no public transport in Israel during Shabbat. Therefore, I had to hire a private means to get to my destination. 4. I spent over 6 hours in CDG airport.  5. Representatives of Air France denied to provide a free access to the airport lounge, which caused even greater inconvenience. Also, I was even not provided a voucher to buy food. 6. In addition, Air France representatives in the connection-desk in CDG were extremely rude.   Clearly, despite the fact that the delay was announced the day before, but no provisions were made. This demonstrates a professional negligence.   Before purchasing my ticket, I researched and decided to fly with KLM due the high quality of its service. I am deeply disappointed. Moreover, there is no excuse for an additional failure of the company to provide basic solutions and make the staying during the delayed time convenient for its customers.  The truth is the flight company has a liability for its customers. Due to the loss of precious time in TLV, the expenses in CDG and TLV caused by the delay, and the aggravation caused by the failure of the flight company as well as rudeness of its representatives, I submit this request for a financial compensation. I hope we can settle it down on this grounds without proceeding to legal procedures

Hallo KLM,  Ik heb een ticket om morgen te vliegen va Bonaire naar Schiphol. Vandaag ontdekte ik dat mijn paspoort verlopen is (9-9-'15). Erg dom van mij. Zucht ... tegenwoordig als je vanuit Afrika (ditmaal Lilongwe, via Nairobi) terug gaat richting Schiphol, komt er nog keurig een e-mail binnen om te melden dat on-line check-in mogelijk is. Joehoe! Na inloggen volgt dan de teleurstelling: "Het is helaas niet mogelijk om voor deze vlucht online in te checken. U kunt op de luchthaven inchecken bij een selfservice incheckautomaat of de incheckbalie."  Oh. Dat betekent dan weer geen enkele mogelijkheid om een behoorlijke stoel uit te zoeken, eventueel met bijbetaling, dus stoel 54J. Nog eens zucht. Okay, gold elite niveau telt niet meer mee. Jammer.
Is er een probleem met het online inchecken?

I will be on a Delta ticket.  However, I will have a 3 day layover in Amsterdam...  I am then flying KLM to Kilimanjaro, Tanzania.  I will be carrying a CPAP machine which I will use on board.  Will the CPAP machine be considered as part of the carryon weight when I board in Amsterdam?  It isn't in the US.  However, at Charles De Gaul in January Air France forced me to consider it as part of my carryon weight, and therefore I had to check my carryon...  it was to no avail that I argued that I was on a Delta ticket.

Mijn complimenten voor de fantastische crew op vlucht KL1049 naar Bristol vanochtend om 8.30 uur. Ik vloog in mijn eentje met 2 kleintjes, waarvan de jongste pas 2 maanden oud is. Beste KLM,  Afgelopen februari een geweldige vakantie gehad op Bonaire, natuurlijk met KLM. Onze zoon (12) is gek van vliegtuigen en wil dolgraag piloot worden. Ik ben zelf niet zo gecharmeerd van die metalen vogels en daardoor hoor ik elk geluid. De terug vlucht was een nachtvlucht, en toen we rustig op kruishoogte vlogen hoorde we een enorm hard getik op het dak van het vliegtuig, alsof er zware regenval of hagel op viel. Het vliegtuig was volledig stil, en er was ook geen reden voor paniek maar ik heb me wel altijd afgevraagd wat het geweest zou kunnen zijn. Hopelijk kunnen jullie de vraag beantwoorden, wat was dat geluid?  Trouwens, geweldige service, geweldige maatschappij.  Groet,

Koffer verschollen Teil 2: Nach stundenlangen Telefonaten mit dem Callcenter kommt man nicht weiter, weder die Abteilung für Gepäckverlust (Ein Callcenter dessen Firmennamen man nicht rausbekommt und schon gar nicht den Firmen-Sitz) noch die Firma Aviapartner die für KLM arbeitet die nicht ans Telefon geht. Man spricht auf den AB, da die Leitungen überlastet sind (welch ein Wunder) und bekommt keine Rückantwort! Aktueller Status: Der Koffer ist nicht eindeutig auffindbar. Eine Airline ist nicht in der Lage innerhalb von drei Tagen eine Antwort aus Rom zu erhalten...und einen Koffer zu 100 Prozent eindeutig zu tracken ist das möglich? Was wäre wenn der Koffer riskanten Inhalt hätte... das will ich mir gar nict ausmalen. Jeder erzählt was anderes. KLM reagierte auf meine Facebookmeldung von gestern und schreibt: Wir haben den Status deines Gepäcks überprüft und herausgefunden, dass es erst gestern lokalisiert wurde. Du wirst es sicherlich bald erhalten. Erstmal sind wir nicht per-Du auch wenn wir auf Facebook sind und wo sich der Koffer genau befindet und wann er zurück kommt wird nicht gesagt, nur eine Email durchgegeben wo man sich einen Wolf tippen muss und ! Bin somit genauso schlau wie vorher. Nun habe ich den Callcenter Mitarbeiter das 20 mal angerufen, dessen Firma und Sitz er nicht nennen darf. Die dürfen noch nicht mal einen zurück rufen. Es gibt keine Rufnummern weder vom Airport in Rom noch in Düsseldorf, die er mir geben könnte, damit ich selbst handeln kann. Die Herrschaften bevorzugen den Mailverkehr !!! Somit geht die Suche weiter!! um einen Vorgesetzten ans Telefon zu bekommen, muss man hier wohl noch 10 weitere Posts veröffentlichen... Hinweis: Koffer sind maximal bis ca. 1250 Euro versichert und Schadensersatz für Ausfälle gibt es nicht wirklich. Also bitte tut euch ein Gefallen und achtet auf die Serviceleistung der Unternehmen. Wenn einem eimal so etwas passiert, dann weiß man es beim nächsten mal besser. Mal sehen wie die Reise weitergeht und ob KLM den Beitrag hier löschen wird...
Having trouble checking in online

Koffer verschollen Teil3: jetzt ist der Koffer gar nicht in Düsseldorf angekommen, sondern befindet sich schon seit 3 Tagen in Rom. Afgelopen maandag kwamen wij terug uit Lissabon ,bewust voor de K L M gekozen meer voor onze ticket uit gegeven !!! kapot vliegtuig of wat dan ook . jullie kunnen ons alles wijs maken .met transavia terug .niet de services zoals bij de K L M .,geen kussentje voor mijn rug . ik ben een rug patient ,daarom kies ik met vliegen voor wat comfort .kijk maar naar mijn vlieg status .er werd om geroepen de business en comfort kregen hun geld wat ze extra betaald hadden terug ??? ik die bewust meer betaald heb voor mijn ticket  vanwege mijn rug ,nee,,,, daar is geen vergoeding voor . ik kan haast niet lopen van de rug pijn ,momenteel. vorig jaar komen we terug uit Bangkok ,5 kwartier  business gevlogen met 4 personen ,moesten we terug ,olie lekkage ,we zijn veilig aan gekomen .ja ja toen was het een bird crash ,ook dat kunnen jullie op onze mouw spelden want dan hoeven jullie niks uit te keren .ik hoorde bij mij in de salon van een hoge K L M persoon, zaten jullie in dat vliegtuig !!  daar was heel veel om te doen tijdens deze vlucht . dus de K L M wereld was zeer ongerust tijdens onze terug vlucht .zakelijk moest ik heel veel regelen ,telefoon en een kleine vergoeding van 150,00 euro per persoon zou ons vergoed worden . 2 x mail contact gehad ,verder nooit meer wat gehoord ,ook geen vergoeding ontvangen . dus de woorden in het vliegtuig en mijn rug pijn heeft mij toe aangezet om dit  via multi media mede te delen .

There must be some words that can help deliver my current feeling from the unpleasant experience today provided by KLM; to name a few, I would say that I am so exhausted, disappointed, and irritated from the arrangement of your staffs.   My original flight was supposed to be leaving Hamburg for Amsterdam at 15:05 on Oct 4 and catching a connecting flight from Amsterdam to Hong Kong at 17:15 same day. However, I was told that my flight was cancelled due to bad weather condition and had “NO CHOICE” but to accept a detour from Hamburg to Paris and wait for more than 7 hours in Charles de Gaulle. PLUS, the KLM staff in Hamburg who just told me to run for my flight without giving me any meal coupons for the delay (I learnt that I was entitled to the meal coupons from staffs of Air France after arrived Charles de Gaulle). What was the staff of KLM Hamburg thinking??? I wouldn’t feel hungry waiting for a flight for more than 7 hours?  Please pay attention: Here is the most serious problem! I asked the KLM staff in Hamburg why my original flight was cancelled and she told me it was due to bad weather condition BUT I checked a few popular websites that provide real-time weather condition showed that the weather in BOTH “Hamburg & Amsterdam” were “SUNNY” especially during the time of my flight. I believe you can easily check these records on your side. Your staff “LIED”!!!!  The last but not least, I was told by other passengers that delayed flight for longer than 6 hours entitled to monetary compensation; thus, I asked 4 different employees of Air France in Charles de Gaulle whether or not I will get a compensation right away and they all told me that I have to send this email to on the airline website and I will get a refund for my ticket.   Here is the summary of what happened:  • My flight was not just delayed BUT cancelled and I was forced to be detoured for no “ACTUAL” reason.  • All other passengers who had the same situation received meal coupons and I had nothing provided but paid for meal out of my own pocket.  • The KLM staff told me to run for the flight at the very last minute while I told her I need to get tax refund; she told me that I can get it in Paris or back in HK. WRONG because I didn’t even get the custom stamp on the refund receipt yet. Lucky I found out in Charles de Gaulle but had to walk a long way passed the security check and come back again. It took me more than an HOUR!!  So, please arrange:  • Provide the FACT why my flight was cancelled (I paid for almost double of average fare for my original schedule and KLM cancelled it by LYING to me.)  • Refund my ticket. I wanted to arrive HK at 10:30am Monday Oct 5 in the morning because I needed to go back to office after this business trip right after landing BUT I arrived HK on Monday night instead. I LOST A DAY! With a LIE, KLM is no difference from scammed my DAY away, how does KLM compensate a day to me due to the so-called BAD weather??  • Pay my meal expenses in Charles de Gaulle and I will provide the receipt when someone from KLM gets back to me.

You lost our bags and you didn't apologise! And what's worse I had genuinely started to like you as an airline, and my wife and I were looking to book another flight to Europe with you for next year - not anymore!  We arrived home from Amsterdam yesterday to the news that you hadn't placed our bags on our flight from Abhu Dhabi to Perth. In our bags were our house keys, my wifes laptop with her clincial research study on it, gifts for loved ones and of course our clothes.   I cannot believe that you did not have the time to transfer our bags onto our connecting flight - that we booked with you! We had to hang around for 2hrs at Abhu Dhabi waiting for our plane - surely that was enough time for you to transfer the bags.   Now I don't know if you're going to blame Etihad Airways for this - because they as your partner airline operated the second flight... but I don't care. It's not acceptable - they were acting as your agent and they acted reprehensibly.   When we got to Perth we went to speak to the Etihad representative. Their comment was "Oh bags miss flights all the time" there attitude was nonchalant. They at no time apologised or offered compensation.   Our bags will hopefully arrive home today with our house keys and clothes and laptop - but that's not really ok at all. We didn't pay for our bags to arrive a day later than we did.   As far as I am concerned the fault lies with you! I would like to know what compensation you will be providing us and I would like an apology.   The flight number was KL 437.  I look forward to your reply.  Michael

Dear KLM,  I am deeply disappointed with your customer service and apathetic approach to customer requests. One week ago, I messaged you to order a ticket for me and apply a voucher I received few months ago. After few days of messaging where it became obvious that my problem was given barely any attention, I was presented with a link to purchase the ticket. I was told that once the transaction was confirmed I would receive my ticket. I paid for the ticket and received no response. After 3 days of waiting I messaged you again only to find out that you have problem with the card used and didn't bother to tell me before I started messaging you again. Now I'm being offered the same ticket for a 165% of the previous price because your lack of response for 3 days caused the ticket price to go up. I understand that problems may arise from online payment but it is not acceptable to neglect informing the customer and waiting until the price jumps up to 165% of the original to proceed with the purchase.

Possibly the worst customer service I have ever experienced!!! Rude, ill-informed, and apathetic staff are all I've been able to speak with so far.  My bags were not placed on my connecting flight from Amsterdam to Cardiff (only an hour flight apart) and it then took them 4 days and SEVERAL calls for them to finally get my bags to my hotel. I could have flown from London back to Amsterdam and picked them up faster myself. While I do understand that accidents happen and anyone can make a mistake, I also expect an international airline to act like they truly care about their customers.One representative told me he could not provide me with a tracking number, name of the company(or contact info) my bags were in transit with, or a manager with whom I could speak to get better service. Now I am trying to get compensation for the money my aunt and I had to spend for clothes and toiletries and KLM customer service can't even be bothered to be polite or timely about fixing THEIR errors. I will not be flying KLM in the future, and as a travel professional will be avoiding booking any clients with them at all costs.

Something I noticed recently. KLM customer service agents always ask for credit card information over the telephone when dealing with certain issues. Assuming phone communications are secure which they aren't, this practise gives the impression that it is safe to give out your credit card information to anyone who may or may not be from a reliable company like KLM. To discourage people giving out their credit card information in this day of banking and online fraud, I suggest that companies like KLM direct their customers to a branch office or their online portal for credit card checks or payments. Just a thought.
